message: Here's your book.
Good day
Good day, all this talk about the Legend is strange, don't you think?

Very strange indeed. I'm just an old fool who would like to grow flowers in the desert, but... I know about this Legend that Dr. FunFrock forbade. I'll tell you what I know if you bring me a sacred book. It is in the Temple of Bù which was buried by a violent sand storm. You can still get in, however, through one of the ventilation shafts still visible just behind me. But be careful: there is danger everywhere!
" This book is a keeper of knowledge. It allows you to read the rocks and to talk to the animals. "
To Principal Island.
I'll leave later on.
I can get you to where you want to go for only 10 Kashes! Where do you want to go?
Sorry, Twinsen, you don't have enough Kashes.
To Citadel Island.
Thanks for opening the grotto. My name is Joe the Elf. I was locked up here because I wasn't meant to be in the story, there might have been some bugs in the game!
See you later, and thanks again.
You're too aggressive! Come back later when you've calmed down.
Ow, you crazy or what? You don't deserve to be an elf, give me your membership card!
Where do you want to go?
Home.
Proxima island.
Rebellion island.
You are the Heir that the prophecy spoke of, Twinsen ! Find your ancestors' legacy, hidden in your home, and pursue your quest. Come back and see me some time.

Only the Heir could have survived in that Temple! You are the Chosen One that the prophecy spoke of. You are worthy of keeping the Book of Bù, Twinsen. It will allow you to decipher the runes and to speak to the animals. The prophecy that must be accomplished is also revealed in its pages: you must overthrow Dr. FunFrock, the despot who has destroyed the harmony that once existed on this planet. In my dreams, I saw him profaning the Well of Sendell, which caused the immediate destruction of this world. You must go to the Well of Sendell to save us from Dr. FunFrock. I don't know where this well is, but your ancestors must have left instructions for you, somewhere in your home.
Hello fellow elf.
Adios! I think I'm going out to discover the world.
You seem to be nice enough, I dub thee an honorary elf. Here's your card. It entitles you to a present.
Hello, quetch !
Good day, horse.
I know the story of the emerald moon, but that's all.
Hii, hi ! Bbbrrrff ! Brf !
I don't know what that could be all about.
Did you know that there are strange noises coming from that symbol on the rocks?

You were the one who freed that gnome with the hideous hat? He asked me if there was a princess that needed freeing in the neighborhood, but if you want my opinion, he doesn't have what it takes to be a hero.
No more gas.
Then you should go visit the Maritime museum on Proxima island.
I can't help you, sorry.
I'm looking for the plans of the Teleportation Center.
They say that there are treasures hidden in a temple, somewhere in the desert.
I'm looking for information about LeBorgne the pirate.
I read some excerpts from the Captain's log, that LeBorgne was ruthless! If you're still interested, the log is for sale at the Old Burg bazaar, on the Principal island.
I don't know where they are.
I don't know anything about it, but I think a while ago the library had some books that spoke of it.
I don't know where they are, but we elves don't need that sort of stuff. We can teleport ourselves magically! Well, I forgot how, but I'm not a good example.
To the Hamalayi mountains.
I'll give you my guitar in exchange for the flute that you possess Twinsen, beforehand, though, you will have play it next to the Clear Water Lake in order to obtain the 4th magical symbol.
You will no longer need the flute, Twinsen. On the other hand, it might allow me to realize an old dream of mine. I'll trade you for this guitar that I found in the middle of a meteor.
Good day
